details.environment: Arctic, Desert, Forest, Hill, Swamp, Urban

habitat.custom: Arctic, Desert, Forest, Hill, Swamp, Urban

languages.custom: the languages it knew in life

description.value: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

The revenant makes two fist attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra [[/damage 4d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape DC 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a [[/save wis 15 format=long]]. On a failure, the target is &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant’s next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the revenant for 1 minute. The &Reference[frightened]{frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the &Reference[frightened]{frightened} condition on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Regeneration. The revenant regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes &Reference[fire]{fire} or &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the revenant’s next turn. The revenant’s body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Rejuvenation. When the revenant’s body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to &Reference[force]{force} the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Turn Immunity. The revenant is immune to effects that turn &Reference[undead]{undead}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Vengeful Tracker. The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
